content: #[rustc_deprecated] has to be used when staged APIs are enabled. As far as I know this has the same behavior as #[deprecated]. Is there a reason the #[rustc_deprecated] attribute couldn't be removed? The only difference I can see is that reasons and when it was deprecated are required for the rustc version, but this seems like it could be enforced separately (say, by checking if staged APIs are enabled).
I think anything starts with #[rustc_ is purely t-compiler topic...
Mind moving this thread, then? If you're able.
This topic was moved by Josh Triplett to #t-compiler > #[rustc_deprecated]
